type.en: Course with defence at the end

description.en: There are 7 thematic blocks in the exam, each with a different number of questions. The blocks are: Internal medicine and infectious diseases, Cardiology, cardiac surgery, pulmonology and thoracic surgery, hematology and oncology, Surgery (general surgery, vascular surgery, urology, paediatric surgery, traumatology and orthopaedics , anaesthesiology and intensive care), Obstetrics and gynaecology, Paediatrics and family medicine, Neurology and psychiatry, Ophthalmology, otorhinolaryngology, dermatology and venereology.
description.et: Eksam koosneb 7 teemablokist, mis on erineva küsimuste arvuga. Teemablokid on: Sisehaigused ja nakkushaigused, Kardioloogia, kardiokirurgia, pulmonoloogia ja torakaalkirurgia ning hematoloogia ja onkoloogia, Kirurgia (üldkirurgia, vaskulaarkirurgia, uroloogia, lastekirurgia, traumatoloogia-ortopeedia, anestesioloogia ja intensiivravi), Sünnitusabi ja naistehaigused, Lastehaigused ja peremeditsiin, Närvihaigused ja psühhiaatria, Silma-, kõrva-nina-kurgu- ning naha- ja suguhaigused.

Written multiple choice test. 
The number of examination questions is 160. Each correctly answered question gives 1 point. The exam is considered passed with a positive grade, if more than 50% of the possible 160 points, i.e. at least 81 points, are collected. A relative scale is used for evaluating the results of the final exam, i.e. the point scale between the maximum achieved result (by the best of the examinees) and the minimum allowed positive result (81 points) is divided into five equal parts (quintiles). Scores within these ranges (from the best down to the worst) correspond to grades A, B, C, D, and E, respectively. A score of 80 or less corresponds to the grade "F".

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.recommended_materials: The exam covers all clinical subjects taught in the IV, V and VI courses: internal medicine with infectious diseases, thoracic and cardiac surgery, surgical specialties (including general surgery, vascular surgery, urology, and pediatric surgery), traumatology and orthopedics, oncology, anesthesiology, intensive care, and emergency medicine, gynecology and obstetrics, pediatrics, neurology with neurosurgery, psychiatry, skin and venereal diseases, ear-nose-throat diseases, ophthalmology, and family medicine.
